sentence.text: Many teachers were unsure that they would get much out of the appraisal and felt that it would change little , especially in the light of probable cuts in spending in education .
When , she thought , had there ever been a moment when she had been unsure that she disliked him ?
When she was still unsure he patted her shoulder .
Ask at your council or local advice group if you are unsure what you can claim .
What puzzled observers was that , if the umpires were unsure who caused the collision , prompting a green flag , why should they penalise Conner ?
If you are unsure what sort of a handshaker you are , practise a few times with a friend .
He was unsure how he should handle her .
As I am unsure which department of the Borough Council would have responsibility for a matter like this I am addressing my letter to you and trust that you will pass it on to the appropriate office .
But the Scottish Office remained unsure how the board could proceed without the use of juniors , and asked how it could continue once the exemption ended .
Corman , who was both producer and director of The Trip , was unsure about Nicholson 's script .
They were still unsure about what to put on the B-side , and only made a final decision as they travelled to the recording studio on the bus .
If you are unsure about the adequacy of your daily diet , look at the list of symptoms below .
If I am unconvinced about compulsory changes in auditors , I am equally unsure about regulating non-audit services by auditors .
Two surveys whose findings are published today show that many voters are unsure about some main planks of Government policy .
The woman stood in the hallway for a moment like a blind person unsure of her direction .
If you are unsure of which flowers will be suitable , or are hard-pressed to think of any small flowers at all , there are many alpine plants that may be ideal .
She looked at the detective , unsure of his response .
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure of her conviction .
We 're unsure in which direction to go next . "
Rick is unsure as to what his next move in this direction will be .
Initially he was unsure about accepting the job .
Flynn got all the really difficult contracts , or the ones John was unsure of being able to visit regularly ; Flynn was the one man John would trust to manage an entire contract on his own .

Merger of Banstead and Horton had been decided upon as an option as early as 1979 , and NHS managers were unsure of how far comprehensive community service without mental hospitals could be developed .
With the death of the child , she felt that a cycle of her life had rolled to its conclusion , yet she was unsure of how to address the new beginning .
However , about one tenth of teachers were unsure as to whether it had been submitted .
They were unsure as to whether they would be allowed to use her any more .
If you are unsure , get expert advice from the chemical manufacturer .
Or possibly they are simply unsure , and are biding their time . "
` I was unsure whether my theories would work , " he answered .
He is unsure whether the constant upheaval affected his development .
Her relationship with her boyfriend had lasted six years , but she was unsure whether to move in with him .
